Question
========
  
The mean in a sample of 25 is 15, the variance 9.

Calculate the 95% confidence interval for the population mean. 
Answerlist
----------
* 13.82 ; 16.18
* 13.76 ; 16.24
* 11.28 ; 18.72
* 14.75 ; 15.25

Solution
========

$95\% \; BI:\;gemiddelde\pm t._{025}\times se$

So you must first find the t-value and calculate the standard error.

* * value at $df=n-1=25-1=24:\;2.064$

$se = \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}} = \frac{3}{5} = 0.6$

Filling in gives: $15 \pm 2.064 \times 0.6 \rightarrow 13.76\; ;\; 16.24$


Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Correct
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
